title: Syria and the inevitability of failed transitions in Arab Spring countries
summary: In a country occupied by foreign powers, exhausted by a decade of civil war and located in a region where revolutions have destabilized institutions, the new authorities in Damascus face a monumental challenge in attempting to restore Syrian sovereignty.

title: Macron says he will ask French to 'decide' on 'crucial issues' in 2025
summary: During his televised New Year's address to the nation, the French president appeared to propose one or more referendums to break political deadlock.

title: Ukraine must fight in 2025 on 'battlefield' and 'negotiating table', Zelensky says
summary: 'May 2025 be our year,' Zelensky said in an address to the nation just before the clock struck midnight in Kyiv. 'We know that peace will not be given to us as a gift but we will do everything to stop Russia and end the war.'

title: Introverted young people don't want to be the life of the party: 'I have to be prepared to have the energy sucked out of me'
summary: While some people look forward to the end of the year to celebrate, others force themselves to go to parties or discos with a lump in their stomach. Whether prostrate by the dance floor or hiding in a room, introverts each develop their own survival techniques.

title: What to drink on New Year's Eve around the world
summary: From one continent to another, journalists from Le Monde regale us with accounts of the festivities in their host countries.

title: Romania and Bulgaria fully join Schengen zone after 13-year wait
summary: The expansion, made possible when Austria and other members dropped their objections to the former communist countries joining, officially took place at midnight on January 1, marked by ceremonies at various border posts.

title: Russian gas flows to Europe via Ukraine drop to zero on January 1, says Kyiv
summary: Ukraine has been allowing Russia to pipe gas to Europe via its territory under a five-year deal signed in 2019, but Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has ruled out extending it amid Russia's invasion.

title: Zimbabwe abolishes death penalty
summary: No executions had been carried out in 20 years. Prisoners on death row will see their sentences commuted.

title: US Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts warns judicial independence is under threat
summary: Roberts laid out his concerns in his annual report on the federal judiciary on Tuesday. He wrote that even if court decisions are unpopular or mark a defeat for a presidential administration, other branches of government must be willing to enforce them to ensure the rule of law.

title: Syria: France claims strikes on IS positions
summary: France, being part of the international coalition against the Islamic State group since 2014, has conducted airstrikes on IS positions in Syria, the first since the Assad regime fell, according to the defense minister.

title: Targeted by Israeli government, newspaper 'Haaretz' continues to expose army's abuses in Gaza
summary: The Israeli newspaper is one of the country's few outlets to show the reality of the war on the Palestinian side. This critical approach has earned it a front-line position against the government's attacks on the media.

title: French PM promises 'a different future' for Mayotte after cyclone ravages poor overseas territory
summary: During a brief visit, Prime Minister François Bayrou, along with five ministers, detailed measures to rapidly restore water and electricity access and enable schools to re-open. As well as an emergency law, he announced that a public refoundation agency would be set up, as was done for the reconstruction of Notre-Dame Cathedral.

title: German Chancellor Scholz retorts after Musk's support for far right
summary: In their New Year's speeches, both German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Vice-Chancellor Robert Habeck hit back at tech billionaire Elon Musk, who has repeatedly spoken in support of the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Le Monde's photographers share their memories
summary: What was your most memorable moment at this unmissable event of 2024? What was special for you? What difficulties did you encounter? Four photographers accredited for Le Monde during the Paris Olympic and Paralympic Games look back on the glorious summer.

title: Pelicot rape trial: An appeal trial will be held in 2025, without Dominique Pelicot
summary: Seventeen of the trial's 51 defendants have appealed their convictions received at the criminal court in Avignon, southern France, risking a longer sentence. A second trial is scheduled for late 2025, in nearby Nîmes.

title: Syrian women's distrust of the new government
summary: The messages of moderation conveyed by Ahmad al-Sharaa, the former jihadist turned powerbroker in Damascus, have failed to reassure Syrian women, particularly those from minority communities.

title: UN condemns Taliban ban on Afghan women working at NGOs
summary: 'No country can progress – politically, economically or socially – while excluding half of its population from public life,' said High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk.

title: Power outage hits nearly all of Puerto Rico on New Year's Eve
summary: More than 1.3 million clients of the company Luma Energy were left in the dark. Officials said it could take up to two days to restore power.

title: Lebanon returns fleeing pro-Assad soldiers to Syria
summary: In the last few days, the Lebanese authorities have arrested dozens of officers, soldiers and supporters of the deposed president and handed them over to the new government in Damascus. However, many of the former regime's key figures have managed to flee abroad from Beirut airport.

title: In Mexico, the government steps up its accommodating gestures toward Donald Trump
summary: Claudia Sheinbaum's executive branch has seized fentanyl, dispersed migrant caravans and confiscated millions of Chinese contraband products ahead of the US president-elect's inauguration on January 20.

title: Georgian government steps up repression
summary: After a disputed election, pro-Russian Mikheil Kavelashvili has become the president of this former Soviet republic in the Caucasus. Soon after his inauguration, he has approved a series of legislative amendments intended to tighten control over civil servants and the pro-European protest movement.

title: Raoul Peck, a filmmaker against oblivion
summary: The Haitian author of 'I Am Not Your Negro,' and director of the 'Exterminate All The Brutes' series, has devoted a documentary to South African photographer Ernest Cole, one of the first to document apartheid.

title: FBI makes its largest bomb bust on Virginia farm
summary: Agents found the explosives this week while searching the family home of a 36-year-old man after being tipped off by a neighbor that he was stockpiling weapons and homemade ammunition. A court document said he had used pictures of President Joe Biden for shooting target practice.

title: 'France getting out of its political crisis implies neutralizing the extremes'
summary: While the radical left LFI and far-right RN parties exert increasing pressure on the whole system, the Socialists need to free themselves from LFI's positions on the 2025 budget vote, explains Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: New Year's Eve around the world: Festivities in pictures
summary: From Sydney to Damascus to Paris, communities around the world began welcoming 2025 with spectacular light shows and embraces.

title: New Year's Eve around the world: Festivities in pictures
summary: From Sydney to Damascus to Paris, communities around the world began welcoming 2025 with spectacular light shows and embraces.

title: In New Year's address, Macron admits snap elections cause 'more divisions than solutions'
summary: In his December 31 address to the nation, his shortest since 2017, President Emmanuel Macron highlighted the successes of 2024 and hinted at possible referendums in 2025.

title: Côte d'Ivoire president says French forces to withdraw in January
summary: About 1,000 French soldiers are deployed in Côte d'Ivoire, a close ally. But the country has joined others in the region demanding their departure.

title: Senegal president says no more 'foreign military presence from 2025'
summary: Faye's statement came a month after he announced that France would have to close its military bases in Senegal.

title: End of Russian gas transit through Ukraine puts EU under pressure
summary: Kyiv and Moscow confirmed in two separate statements that Russian gas deliveries to Europe via Ukraine had ceased definitively on Wednesday morning. Despite the war, Russia is still one of Europe's main suppliers of gas, the price of which has soared to its highest level in over a year.

title: Five years after Covid's emergence, we return to Wuhan, the Chinese city where it all began
summary: In this central Chinese city where the SARS-CoV-2 virus first appeared, relentless development is erasing the traces of the infamous pandemic. Now buried under a heavy political silence, this 'bad dream' has left a 'bitterness' among the population.

title: South Korea will send Jeju Air crash black box to US
summary: Korean, American and Boieng investigators are working on extracting the data to understand what caused the crash that killed 179 of the 181 people on board.

title: Poland's EU presidency promises to be highly political
summary: On the strength of his European experience and his membership of the EPP, the dominant party in Brussels, Prime Minister Donald Tusk intends to demonstrate that his government's pro-European choices are the right ones, ahead of the Polish presidential election in May.

title: At least 10 killed in New Orleans car-ramming attack
summary: Authorities also said 30 people were injured in the incident on the crowded Canal and Bourbon Streets during New Year celebrations.

title: 2024 in elections: The year half the world's voting-age population went to the polls
summary: 2024 was been a historic electoral year, marked by major ballots around the world. The population living in countries where elections were held totaled 4.1 billion people – half of the planet's inhabitants. Here's a look back at a very special year.

title: Victor Wembanyama's ever-improving performances charm San Antonio
summary: Soon to turn 21, the French star of the San Antonio Spurs is off to a fine start to his second season, and is proving to be a serious contender for a spot in the NBA All-Star Game.

title: At the Mayotte field hospital: 'We finally have the Rolls Royce of care'
summary: The 32 white tents of this temporary hospital accommodate an average of 200 people a day, from shantytown dwellers to the middle class. For the local population, the facility has become the most tangible sign of France's aid to its overseas territory, in the wake of Cy.

title: A year of crisis in French Parliament, in photos
summary: Photojournalist Julien Muguet regularly works for Le Monde, covering events at the Assemblée Nationale. Here's a look back at a year full of twists, with four prime ministers, snap elections, and two caretaker governments.

title: Covid-19: Five years on, search for origin of SARS-CoV-2 remains fruitless
summary: Five years after the start of the Covid-19 pandemic, the two main hypotheses – illegal wildlife trade and a laboratory accident – remain unresolved.

title: Palestinian Authority suspends Al Jazeera broadcasts
summary: Tensions between the Doha-based network and the Fatah movement of Palestinian President Mahmud Abbas, have risen in recent weeks following the channel's coverage of clashes between Palestinian security forces and militants in Jenin.

title: Tesla Cybertruck explodes outside Trump hotel in Las Vegas, killing one
summary: Video footage shows the stainless steel vehicle parked at the hotel entrance before bursting into flames. Authorities said there was 'one deceased individual inside the Cybertruck' while seven people received 'minor' injuries.
